1.text: A false balance is abomination to the LORD: but a just weight is his delight.

2.text: When pride comes, then comes shame: but with the lowly is wisdom.

3.text: The integrity of the upright shall guide them: but the perverseness of transgressors shall destroy them.

4.text: Riches profit not in the day of wrath: but righteousness delivers from death.

5.text: The righteousness of the perfect shall direct his way: but the wicked shall fall by his own wickedness.

6.text: The righteousness of the upright shall deliver them: but transgressors shall be taken in their own naughtiness.

7.text: When a wicked man dies, his expectation shall perish: and the hope of unjust men perishes.

8.text: The righteous is delivered out of trouble, and the wicked comes in his stead.

9.text: An hypocrite with his mouth destroys his neighbor: but through knowledge shall the just be delivered.

10.text: When it goes well with the righteous, the city rejoices: and when the wicked perish, there is shouting.

11.text: By the blessing of the upright the city is exalted: but it is overthrown by the mouth of the wicked.

12.text: He that is void of wisdom despises his neighbor: but a man of understanding holds his peace.

13.text: A talebearer reveals secrets: but he that is of a faithful spirit conceals the matter.

14.text: Where no counsel is, the people fall: but in the multitude of counsellors there is safety.

15.text: He that is surety for a stranger shall smart for it: and he that hates indebtedness is sure.

16.text: A gracious woman retains honor: and strong men retain riches.

17.text: The merciful man does good to his own soul: but he that is cruel troubles his own flesh.

18.text: The wicked works a deceitful work: but to him that sows righteousness shall be a sure reward.

19.text: As righteousness tends to life: so he that pursues evil pursues it to his own death.

20.text: They that are of a fraudulent heart are abomination to the LORD: but such as are upright in their way are his delight.

21.text: Though hand join in hand, the wicked shall not be unpunished: but the seed of the righteous shall be delivered.

22.text: As a jewel of gold in a swineâ€™s snout, so is a fair woman which is without discretion.

23.text: The desire of the righteous is only good: but the expectation of the wicked is wrath.

24.text: There is that scatters, and yet increases; and there is that withholds more than is meet, but it tends to poverty.

25.text: The liberal soul shall be made fat: and he that waters shall be watered also himself.

26.text: He that withholds corn, the people shall curse him: but blessing shall be on the head of him that sells it.

27.text: He that diligently seeks good procures favor: but he that seeks mischief, it shall come to him.

28.text: He that trusts in his riches shall fall; but the righteous shall flourish as a branch.

29.text: He that troubles his own house shall inherit the wind: and the fool shall be servant to the wise of heart.

30.text: The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life; and he that wins souls is wise.

31.text: Behold, the righteous shall be recompensed in the earth: much more the wicked and the sinner.
